newsitem.title: SWEDEN: Ericsson to sell Swedish plastics unit.
newsitem.headline: Ericsson to sell Swedish plastics unit.

text.p: Swedish telecoms group LM Ericsson AB on Monday said it was to sell its plastic production unit at Kristianstad in southern Sweden to Swedish plastic/rubber components sub-contractor Nolato AB.
No financial details of the deal were released.

Ericsson said it had signed a letter of intent under which Nolato would take over all Ericsson Telecom AB's activities connected with the manufacturing of plastic components, including the production plant.
The 600 or so employees at the Kristianstad plant would be offered jobs with Nolato.
Ericsson said in a statement that the factory, with a turnover of $67 million in 1995, had the largest production of plastic components in Europe.
Half of the production is fronts for Ericsson mobile phones.
The factory is also a subsupplier to the automotive industry, especially AB Volvo.
The final agreement between the two companies was subject to approval from the Swedish Competition Authority.
The transfer is planned for January 1, 1997, Ericsson said in a statement.
